member.name: T:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator
member.summary: Utility class with static methods that do various useful things with bitmaps that require multiple GDI+ calls with .NET CLR

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.GetBitmapFromUri(System.String)
member.summary:
Attempts to download a bitmap from a given URI, then loads the bitmap into a Bitmap object and returns.
Obviously there are numerous failure cases for a function like this. For ease of use, all errors will be reported in a catch-all BitmapManipException, which provides a textual error message based on the exception that occurs. As usual, the underlying exception is available in InnerException property.
Times out after 10 seconds waiting for a response from the server.
member.param: String containing URI from which to retrieve image
member.returns: Bitmap object from URI. Shouldn't ever be null, as any error will be reported in an exception.

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.GetBitmapFromUri(System.Uri)
member.summary:
Attempts to download a bitmap from a given URI, then loads the bitmap into a Bitmap object and returns.
Obviously there are numerous failure cases for a function like this. For ease of use, all errors will be reported in a catch-all BitmapManipException, which provides a textual error message based on the exception that occurs. As usual, the underlying exception is available in InnerException property.
Times out after 10 seconds waiting for a response from the server.
member.param: Uri object specifying the URI from which to retrieve image
member.returns: Bitmap object from URI. Shouldn't ever be null, as any error will be reported in an exception.

Attempts to download a bitmap from a given URI, then loads the bitmap into a Bitmap object and returns.
Obviously there are numerous failure cases for a function like this. For ease of use, all errors will be reported in a catch-all BitmapManipException, which provides a textual error message based on the exception that occurs. As usual, the underlying exception is available in InnerException property.
member.param: String containing URI from which to retrieve image
Timeout (in milliseconds) to wait for response
member.returns: Bitmap object from URI. Shouldn't ever be null, as any error will be reported in an exception.

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ConvertBitmapToJpeg(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to a JPEG with a specific quality level
member.param: Bitmap to convert
Specifies a quality from 0 (lowest) to 100 (highest), or -1 to leave unspecified
member.returns: A new bitmap object containing the input bitmap converted. If the destination format and the target format are the same, returns a clone of the destination bitmap.

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ConvertBitmapToTiff(System.Drawing.Bitmap,WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.TiffCompressionEnum)
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to a Tiff with a specific compression
member.param: Bitmap to convert

The compression to use on the TIFF file output. Be warned that the CCITT3, CCITT4, and RLE compression options are only applicable to TIFFs using a palette index color depth (that is, 1, 4, or 8 bpp). Using any of these compression schemes with 24 or 32-bit TIFFs will throw an exception from the bowels of GDI+
member.returns: A new bitmap object containing the input bitmap converted. If the destination format and the target format are the same, returns a clone of the destination bitmap.

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ConvertBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.String)
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to another bitmap format, returning the new converted bitmap
member.param: Bitmap to convert
MIME type of format to convert to
member.returns: A new bitmap object containing the input bitmap converted. If the destination format and the target format are the same, returns a clone of the destination bitmap.

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ConvertBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to another bitmap format, returning the new converted bitmap
member.param: Bitmap to convert
Bitmap format to convert to
member.returns: A new bitmap object containing the input bitmap converted. If the destination format and the target format are the same, returns a clone of the destination bitmap.

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ScaleBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Double)
member.summary: Scales a bitmap by a scale factor, growing or shrinking both axes while maintaining the original aspect ratio
member.param: Bitmap to scale
Factor by which to scale
member.returns: New bitmap containing image from inputBmp, scaled by the scale factor

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ScaleBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Scales a bitmap by a scale factor, growing or shrinking both axes independently, possibly changing the aspect ration
member.param: Bitmap to scale
Factor by which to scale
member.returns: New bitmap containing image from inputBmp, scaled by the scale factor

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ResizeBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Resizes a bitmap's width and height independently
member.param: Bitmap to resize
New width
New height

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ThumbnailBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates a thumbnail of the bitmap. This is effectively a specialized resize function, which maintains the aspect ratio of the image while resizing it to ensure that both its width and height are within caller-specified maximums
member.param: Bitmap for which to generate thumbnail
Maximum width of thumbnail
Maximum height of thumbnail
member.returns: Thumbnail of inputBmp w/ the same aspect ratio, but width and height both less than or equal to the maximum limits

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ReverseBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Reverses a bitmap, effectively rotating it 180 degrees in 3D space about the Y axis. Results in a "mirror image" of the bitmap, reversed much as it would be in a mirror

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.FlipBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Reverses a bitmap, effectively rotating it 180 degrees in 3D space about the X axis. Results in an upside-down view of the image

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.OverlayBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Renders a bitmap over another bitmap, with a specific alpha value. This can be used to overlay a logo or watermark over a bitmap
member.param: Bitmap over which image is to be overlaid
Bitmap to overlay
Alpha value fo overlay bitmap. 0 = fully transparent, 100 = fully opaque
Location in destination bitmap where overlay image will be placed

member.name: M:WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.OverlayBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32,WebMeeting.BitmapManipulator.ImageCornerEnum)
member.summary: Renders a bitmap over another bitmap, with a specific alpha value. This can be used to overlay a logo or watermark over a bitmap
member.param: Bitmap over which image is to be overlaid
Bitmap to overlay
Alpha value fo overlay bitmap. 0 = fully transparent, 100 = fully opaque
Corner of destination bitmap to place overlay bitmap

Rectangle specifying the range of pixels within the image which is to be retained

member.name: T:BalloonCS.HoverBalloon
member.summary: A sample class to manipulate ballon tooltips. Windows XP balloon-tips if used properly can be very helpful. This class creates a balloon tooltip. This becomes useful for showing important information quickly to the user. For example in a data-entry form full of controls the most important and used control is the Order Placement button. Guide the user by using this hover balloon on it. This helps in a shorter learning cycle of the application.

member.summary: Sets the maximum text width of the tooltip text. At that length the tooltip will start wrapping text over to the next line.

Performs timer opertations. Use the following commands:
DirectXTimer.Reset - to reset the timer DirectXTimer.Start - to start the timer DirectXTimer.Stop - to stop (or pause) the timer DirectXTimer.Advance - to advance the timer by 0.1 seconds DirectXTimer.GetAbsoluteTime - to get the absolute system time DirectXTimer.GetApplicationTime - to get the current time DirectXTimer.GetElapsedTime - to get the time that elapsed between TIMER_GETELAPSEDTIME calls

member.name: F:WebMeeting.Client.NetworkManager.flag_IsWebImageAlreadyActive
member.summary: This flag is used to check if the the webshare image based module has already been shared or not. and is initilaised with a 0 When ever the Webshare is closed it should be assigned 0 again as on the start up when there was no instance of web was shared. When ever it has a value >0 it means that new generic Whiteboard control doesn't need to be initialised

member.name: M:WebMeeting.Client.NetworkManager.ReceiveMessage(WebMeeting.Common.MessageObject)
member.summary: Member Description Aborted The thread is in the Stopped state. AbortRequested The ThreadAbort method has been invoked on the thread, but the thread has not yet received the pending System.Threading. ThreadAbortException that will attempt to terminate it. Background The thread is being executed as a background thread, as opposed to a foreground thread. This state is controlled by setting the IsBackground property of the Thread class. Running The thread has been started, it is not blocked, and there is no pending ThreadAbortException. Stopped The thread has stopped. StopRequested The thread is being requested to stop. This is for internal use only. Suspended The thread has been suspended. SuspendRequested The thread is being requested to suspend. Unstarted The Thread.Start method has not been invoked on the thread. WaitSleepJoin The thread is blocked as a result of a call to Wait, Sleep or Join methods.
